storyTitle: As Employee, I want to perform viewing task update history to achieve transparency

testCases.title: Validate display of complete task update history
preconditions: User is logged into the system with valid credentials
User has access permissions to view task details
At least one task exists with multiple status changes and comments
Task has a minimum of 5 historical updates (status changes and comments)
Browser is supported (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge)

steps.action: Navigate to the task detail page by clicking on a task from the task list
steps.expectedResult: Task detail page loads successfully and displays task information

steps.action: Click on the 'Update History' tab or section within the task detail page
steps.expectedResult: Update history tab becomes active and displays the history section

steps.action: Observe the complete list of status changes and comments displayed in the history section
steps.expectedResult: Complete chronological list of all task status changes and comments is displayed in descending order (newest first)

steps.action: Verify that each status change entry shows the timestamp in readable format (e.g., 'Jan 15, 2024 10:30 AM')
steps.expectedResult: All status change entries display accurate timestamps in consistent format

steps.action: Verify that each update entry shows the user name or identifier who made the change
steps.expectedResult: All updates display the correct user details (name, username, or user ID) who performed the action

steps.action: Verify that status changes show both 'from' and 'to' status values (e.g., 'Changed from In Progress to Completed')
steps.expectedResult: Status change entries clearly indicate the previous status and new status

steps.action: Verify that comment entries display the full comment text along with commenter details
steps.expectedResult: All comments are displayed with complete text and associated user information

steps.action: Scroll through the entire history list from top to bottom
steps.expectedResult: List scrolls smoothly without lag, freezing, or errors. All entries remain properly formatted during scrolling

steps.action: Check the page load time from when the history tab is clicked until all data is displayed
steps.expectedResult: History data loads and displays within 3 seconds

steps.action: Verify that no error messages or console errors appear during the display of history
steps.expectedResult: No errors are displayed on the UI or in the browser console

postconditions: Task update history remains displayed on screen
No data has been modified in the system
History data is ready for further filtering or export operations

testCases.title: Verify filtering of history by date and update type
preconditions: User is logged into the system with valid credentials
User has navigated to the task update history tab
Task history contains updates spanning multiple dates (at least 30 days)
Task history contains both status changes and comments
History list is fully loaded and displayed
Filter controls are visible and accessible

steps.action: Locate the date range filter controls on the history page
steps.expectedResult: Date range filter with 'From Date' and 'To Date' fields is visible and accessible

steps.action: Click on the 'From Date' field and select a start date (e.g., 7 days ago)
steps.expectedResult: Date picker opens and allows date selection. Selected date is populated in the 'From Date' field

steps.action: Click on the 'To Date' field and select an end date (e.g., today's date)
steps.expectedResult: Date picker opens and allows date selection. Selected date is populated in the 'To Date' field

steps.action: Click the 'Apply Filter' or equivalent button to apply the date range filter
steps.expectedResult: History list refreshes and displays only updates that fall within the selected date range. Update count reflects filtered results

steps.action: Verify that all displayed entries have timestamps within the selected date range
steps.expectedResult: All visible history entries have timestamps between the 'From Date' and 'To Date'. No entries outside this range are shown

steps.action: Locate the update type filter dropdown or radio buttons (Status Changes / Comments / All)
steps.expectedResult: Update type filter control is visible with options for filtering by type

steps.action: Select 'Status Changes' from the update type filter
steps.expectedResult: History list updates to show only status change entries. All comment entries are hidden from view

steps.action: Verify that only status change entries are displayed in the filtered list
steps.expectedResult: All visible entries are status changes. No comment entries are present in the list

steps.action: Change the update type filter to 'Comments'
steps.expectedResult: History list updates to show only comment entries. All status change entries are hidden from view

steps.action: Verify that only comment entries are displayed in the filtered list
steps.expectedResult: All visible entries are comments. No status change entries are present in the list

steps.action: Apply both date range and update type filters simultaneously (e.g., Comments from last 7 days)
steps.expectedResult: History list displays only entries that match both filter criteria (comments within the date range)

steps.action: Click the 'Clear Filters' or 'Reset' button
steps.expectedResult: All applied filters are removed. Date fields are cleared and update type is reset to 'All'

steps.action: Verify that the full unfiltered history list is restored
steps.expectedResult: Complete history list is displayed showing all status changes and comments across all dates. Entry count matches original unfiltered count

steps.action: Check that filter operations complete within acceptable time
steps.expectedResult: Each filter application completes within 2-3 seconds with smooth UI response

postconditions: Filters are cleared and full history is displayed
No data has been modified in the database
Filter controls remain functional for subsequent use

testCases.title: Ensure export functionality works correctly
preconditions: User is logged into the system with valid credentials
User has navigated to the task update history tab
Task history contains at least 10 update entries for meaningful export
History list is fully loaded and displayed
Export button or menu is visible on the history page
User has appropriate permissions to export data

steps.action: Locate the 'Export' button on the task update history page
steps.expectedResult: Export button is visible and clickable in the history interface

steps.action: Click on the 'Export' button
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu or dialog appears showing available export formats (CSV and PDF)

steps.action: Select 'CSV' format from the export options
steps.expectedResult: CSV export process initiates. Loading indicator or progress message may appear

steps.action: Wait for the CSV file download to complete
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is automatically downloaded to the browser's default download location. File name follows naming convention (e.g., 'task_history_[taskId]_[date].csv')

steps.action: Navigate to the download location and verify the CSV file exists
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is present in the downloads folder with non-zero file size

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file using a spreadsheet application (Excel, Google Sheets, etc.)
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully without errors. Data is properly formatted in columns

steps.action: Verify CSV file contains header row with column names (e.g., Date, Time, User, Update Type, Description, Status From, Status To)
steps.expectedResult: First row contains appropriate column headers for all data fields

steps.action: Verify that all history entries visible on the screen are present in the CSV file
steps.expectedResult: CSV contains all update records with matching data (timestamps, users, status changes, comments). Row count matches the number of history entries

steps.action: Verify data accuracy by comparing several CSV entries with corresponding on-screen history entries
steps.expectedResult: Data in CSV exactly matches the displayed history information (dates, times, users, descriptions are identical)

steps.action: Return to the task history page and click the 'Export' button again
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu appears again

steps.action: Select 'PDF' format from the export options
steps.expectedResult: PDF export process initiates. Loading indicator or progress message may appear

steps.action: Wait for the PDF file generation and download to complete
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is automatically downloaded to the browser's default download location. File name follows naming convention (e.g., 'task_history_[taskId]_[date].pdf')

steps.action: Navigate to the download location and verify the PDF file exists
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is present in the downloads folder with non-zero file size

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using a PDF reader (Adobe Reader, browser, etc.)
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully and displays formatted task history report

steps.action: Verify PDF contains proper header with task information (task ID, task name, export date)
steps.expectedResult: PDF header displays task identification details and report generation timestamp

steps.action: Verify that all history entries are present in the PDF in a readable, formatted layout
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains all update records in chronological order with clear formatting and readability

steps.action: Verify data accuracy by comparing several PDF entries with corresponding on-screen history entries
steps.expectedResult: Data in PDF exactly matches the displayed history information. All timestamps, users, and descriptions are accurate

steps.action: Check that PDF formatting is professional with proper spacing, fonts, and page breaks if applicable
steps.expectedResult: PDF is well-formatted, professional-looking, and suitable for reporting purposes

steps.action: Verify that export operations complete within acceptable time (within 5 seconds for standard history size)
steps.expectedResult: Both CSV and PDF exports complete and download within 5 seconds

postconditions: Two export files (CSV and PDF) are saved in the downloads folder
Task history page remains open and functional
No data has been modified in the system
Exported files contain complete and accurate historical data
Export functionality remains available for subsequent use
